lifestyle.title: Radhika Madan on Loneliness: "It Started Bothering Me..."
lifestyle.description: Actress Radhika Madan opens up about the loneliness of living in Mumbai away from family. She reveals the struggle of coming home to an empty house after award-winning nights. The actress shares the struggles of working in the entertainment industry.

lifestyle.title: Decoding 'Monkey-Barring': The Toxic Dating Trend to Watch Out For!
lifestyle.description: Learn about "monkey-barring," a troubling new dating trend that can be emotionally damaging. This pattern involves manipulation and secrecy between partners. Understand the signs of this toxic behaviour and how to avoid it.

lifestyle.title: Ananya Panday's Body Shaming Struggle: "Not Thin Enough..."
lifestyle.description: Ananya Panday reveals the harsh impact of body shaming during her teenage years. She shares how negative comments affected her self-esteem. The actress explains how the pressure to fit societal beauty standards led her to hide her passion.

lifestyle.title: Nia Sharma's Fiery Clapback: "Kaali Hai? Bhaad Mein Jao!"
lifestyle.description: Actress Nia Sharma silenced trolls who criticized her skin tone with a powerful message. The *Laughter Chefs 2* participant shared that with a little makeup, she feels confident and presentable. This bold response highlights the ongoing battle against body shaming and the importance of self-love in the face of online negativity.

lifestyle.title: Beware! The Deadly Blue-Ringed Octopus Lurks
lifestyle.description: Don't let its size fool you! The blue-ringed octopus, small enough to fit in your hand, carries a potent venom capable of killing humans in minutes. This tiny creature, with its vibrant blue rings, is a stark reminder of nature's hidden dangers. Its venom is a powerful neurotoxin, making it one of the world's most dangerous marine animals.

lifestyle.title: Shilpa Shetty's Fitness Secret: Conquer the Bosu Ball!
lifestyle.description: Want to spice up your workout? Actress Shilpa Shetty swears by Bosu Ball workouts to challenge balance, strength, and coordination. This versatile half-sphere equipment is perfect for boosting core strength and preventing common fitness mistakes. Experts recommend incorporating it into your routine for a more effective and engaging fitness journey.

lifestyle.title: Why Are We Hooked? The Rage-Bait Trap of Social Media
lifestyle.description: Ever found yourself endlessly scrolling through content that annoys you? Welcome to the world of "rage-baiting"! Gen Z and others are often drawn to irritating characters and situations on social media. This article delves into the psychology behind this phenomenon, exploring why we keep engaging with content that triggers us.

history.title: 1985 Punjab Elections: Congress's Determined Push
history.description: Forty years ago, Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi declared the Congress (I)'s serious commitment to winning the Punjab elections. He expressed confidence in the party's strong candidates and promised effective governance. This pivotal moment reflects the political landscape of the time and the strategies employed to secure power.

history.title: 1985: Ordinance Alters Election Rules in India
history.description: In 1985, an ordinance was issued to amend the Representation of the People Act. This change focused on the conditions under which elections could be countermanded, specifically limiting it to the death of a candidate from a recognized political party. This legal update aimed to refine the electoral process.

history.title: Punjab Gears Up for 1985 Elections: Campaigning Begins
history.description: The stage was set for the September 25th elections in Punjab forty years ago, as the deadline for candidate withdrawals passed. With 74 aspirants vying for 13 Lok Sabha seats and 848 candidates competing for 117 assembly seats, the campaigning phase officially began, promising an exciting political contest.

history.title: Tamil Leaders Murdered in Sri Lanka, 1985
history.description: In 1985, Sri Lanka witnessed the tragic assassination of three prominent Tamil United Liberation Front leaders in Jaffna. The bodies of V. Dharmalingam and M. Alalasundaram were discovered, while the fate of two others kidnapped remained unknown. This event highlights the escalating violence of the time.

ahmedabad.title: Ahmedabad: Probe Launched After Couple's Tragic Electrocution
ahmedabad.description: An investigation is underway in Ahmedabad following the alleged electrocution of a couple in the Narol area. The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation and the City Police are conducting separate probes, with allegations of negligence emerging. This collaborative effort seeks to determine the cause of the incident.

ahmedabad.title: Gas Leak Tragedy at Gujarat Fluorochemicals: One Dead, Many Injured
ahmedabad.description: A devastating gas leak at Gujarat Fluorochemicals Limited resulted in one fatality and left thirteen others hospitalized. The incident occurred in a plant producing R-22 refrigerant. Emergency services responded, but the impact on the workers underscores the critical need for safety regulations.

ahmedabad.title: Surat Tragedy: Woman Found Dead, Search On for Missing Children
ahmedabad.description: Surat is in shock as a woman's body was discovered near a creek bridge, sparking a police investigation. Authorities are now frantically searching for three missing children, adding another layer of mystery to the case. Social media appeals and newspaper ads have been launched to identify the deceased and uncover the truth behind this heartbreaking incident.

ahmedabad.title: Congress Gears Up: Kharge to Train District Leaders in Junagadh
ahmedabad.description: In a significant move, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge will kickstart a 10-day training camp for district unit heads in Junagadh. The initiative, part of the "Sangathan Srujan Abhiyan," aims to strengthen the party at the grassroots level. The training will run from September 10th to 19th, focusing on organizational strategies, and leadership development.

ahmedabad.title: Helmet Fine U-Turn? Rajkot MLAs Hint at Two-Month Reprieve
ahmedabad.description: Amidst a crackdown on helmetless riders, Rajkot's authorities are facing scrutiny. While the police continue their drive, two BJP MLAs suggest a temporary pause on the Rs 500 fine for violators. This comes after a two-day enforcement period, raising questions about the implementation of the helmet rule and the government‚Äôs approach.

ahmedabad.title: Gujarat Decriminalizes Minor Offences: Is It 'Ease of Living' or a Free Pass?
ahmedabad.description: The Gujarat Assembly has passed a bill to decriminalize various minor offenses, replacing them with monetary penalties. The move aims to streamline processes. The Opposition raises concerns that the bill could embolden rule-breakers, allowing them to bypass legal consequences by simply paying fines. The changes affect 11 legislations.

ahmedabad.title: Surat Textile Industry Voices Concerns Over Yarn GST
ahmedabad.description: Surat's textile industry leaders are expressing worries over the unchanged GST rate on yarn. An online meeting, led by the Southern Gujarat Chamber of Commerce and Industry (SGCCI), saw discussions on reducing the tax on garments. Industry representatives aim to improve market competitiveness.

ahmedabad.title: Kashmir Concerns: Congress Raises Questions on Intelligence Lapses
ahmedabad.description: During discussions on a resolution, the Congress raised concerns about potential intelligence failures related to the Pahalgam attack. BJP ministers countered by listing terror incidents under the previous government, adding to the political back-and-forth. The debate highlights ongoing security concerns in the region.

delhi.title: Delhi Court Orders Journalist to Pay for Liking a 'Defamatory' Tweet
delhi.description: In a landmark ruling, a Delhi court has ordered NDTV journalist Gargi Rawat to pay ‚Çπ10,000 for liking a tweet considered defamatory. The case involved a post alleging rape. The court's decision has significant implications for online speech and the legal consequences of social media activity.

delhi.title: DU Elections Under Scrutiny: Delhi HC Cites Anti-Defacement Violations
delhi.description: The Delhi High Court has observed potential violations of anti-defacement guidelines during the upcoming Delhi University Students' Union (DUSU) elections. The court has directed the Delhi Police to assist the university. This development raises concerns about the conduct of the election campaigns and adherence to regulations.

delhi.title: Nepali Students in Delhi Fear for Families Amidst Nepal Violence
delhi.description: Nepali students in Delhi are gripped by fear, worried about their families amidst escalating violence back home. The sound of gunfire and the fear of safety are on their minds. They stay in touch with family members who remain in Nepal.

delhi.title: Abhishek Bachchan Moves Delhi HC to Protect Personality Rights
delhi.description: Following Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, actor Abhishek Bachchan has also approached the Delhi High Court to safeguard his personality rights. The court, after hearing the matter, has decided to issue orders. He is raising issues related to misuse of his name.

delhi.title: Delhi Schools in Tin Sheds? High Court Slams Govt!
delhi.description: The Delhi High Court has slammed the Delhi government for running schools in tin sheds, highlighting infrastructure shortcomings. A PIL filed by a civil rights group brought attention to the issue, impacting approximately 1,400 students. The court's reprimand underscores the need for improved facilities, emphasizing the urgency of modernizing educational spaces for students.

delhi.title: BIMTECH Tragedy: Second Student Dies in Hostel Shooting
delhi.description: A second management student has died following a shooting at the BIMTECH hostel in Greater Noida. The 23-year-old succumbed to injuries sustained in the incident, with another student found dead in the same room. College authorities are providing counselling. The incident has sparked shock and grief within the campus community.

delhi.title: Delhi's Green Spaces Face Development Push: Sanjay Van Cafe, MP Bhawan Extension Approved
delhi.description: The Delhi Ridge Management Board has approved various projects, including a cafe in Sanjay Van and an extension of the MP Bhawan. These developments, potentially affecting 224 trees, reflect the balancing act between development and environmental conservation. Decisions like these highlight the ongoing debate around preserving Delhi's green spaces.

delhi.title: Kejriwal Slams Modi Over US Trade Talks: "Surrender!"
delhi.description: Arvind Kejriwal has criticized Prime Minister Modi, accusing him of "surrendering" to Donald Trump on trade negotiations. Kejriwal claims this puts Indian farmers, traders, and youth employment at risk. The AAP leader's remarks reflect growing concerns about the impact of trade deals on the Indian economy, raising public debate.

mumbai.title: Maharashtra Revives Scholarship Exams for Students
mumbai.description: Maharashtra is bringing back the original format of its school-level scholarship exams for Classes 4 and 7 from the 2025-26 academic year. The government aims to broaden access to academic support with this decision. It ensures a smooth transition and equitable opportunities for students across the state.

mumbai.title: Maharashtra to Replace Diesel Tugs with Rs 1,800 Crore E-Tug Plan
mumbai.description: Maharashtra plans to replace its diesel tugboats with 15 e-tugs, in a massive investment exceeding Rs 1,800 crore. Each e-tug will cost around Rs 120-130 crore. This move reflects the state's commitment to modernizing its maritime operations and reducing dependence on fossil fuels.

mumbai.title: Ancient Rice Fields Unearthed: 3,000-Year-Old Discovery in Vidarbha!
mumbai.description: Archaeologists have uncovered evidence of 3,000-year-old rice cultivation in Vidarbha. Excavations at the Pachkhed site revealed lime-processing kilns, iron tools, and terracotta beads. This fascinating find provides invaluable insights into the Early Iron Age, showcasing technological advancements and cultural continuity in ancient India.

mumbai.title: Maharashtra Minister: Kunbi Status to Marathas Requires Careful Scrutiny
mumbai.description: Maharashtra's Revenue Minister emphasizes the need for thorough scrutiny before granting Kunbi status to Marathas. He stresses proper documentation to verify credentials. This position, held by the OBC sub-committee chief, highlights the complexities surrounding caste-based reservations and social justice.

mumbai.title: Stranded in Nepal: Indian Tourists Face Flight Chaos and Distress
mumbai.description: Hundreds of Indians are stranded in Nepal due to flight disruptions caused by protests. Passengers reported a lack of support, food, and water, causing distress, particularly for senior citizens and children. The government is stepping in to assist, highlighting the challenges faced during crises abroad.

mumbai.title: BJP Objects to "Halal Lifestyle Township" Projects in Maharashtra
mumbai.description: The BJP is opposing the trend of "halal lifestyle townships" in Mumbai and its suburbs, objecting to housing projects promoted on religious lines. The party views this as a divisive marketing tactic. This controversy highlights rising concerns over religious identity in urban development.

mumbai.title: Mumbai Woman's Rs 10 Lakh Jewel Heist for Love!
mumbai.description: Mumbai Police have arrested a woman who orchestrated a daring plan to steal valuables worth a whopping Rs 10 lakh! The twist? She was the mastermind! Pretending to be a victim of theft, she hoped to cover her tracks and elope with her lover. However, her charade crumbled, and she now faces charges for the elaborate scheme that aimed to...

mumbai.title: Shiv Sena Cousins Unite? Uddhav & Raj Thackeray Spark Alliance Buzz!
mumbai.description: Political sparks are flying in Mumbai! Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Uddhav Thackeray met with his cousin, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray, at his residence. The sudden meeting has ignited intense speculation about a potential alliance between the two parties. With BMC elections looming, will these estranged cousins unite for a power play?
